title: How do bi-carbonate ions prevent the build-up of hydrogen? - Quora

response.answer_text: I presume you mean hydrogen ions rather than hydrogen which is a gas and won’t react with bicarbonate ions. Bicarbonate (aka hydrogen carbonate) reacts with H+ ions in an acid-base reaction to form carbon dioxide and water: HCO3- + H+ → CO2 + H2O The hydrogen ions are neutralised.
